title: Spain : number of hotels and similar accommodation by number of rooms 2015
summary: The chart at hand is a line chart where the x axis denotes Year and a y axis denotes Number of hotels. In total the number of data points it has is 5.
In general Number of hotels has rose over the Year.
Number of hotels is roughly constant from 100_rooms_or_more to 250_rooms_or_more, and finally slightly increasing from 250_rooms_or_more to Less_than_25_rooms.
The most drastic increase took place within the Year From_25_to_99_rooms and Less_than_25_rooms.
Maximum Number of hotels, about 12170.0 was reported at Year Less_than_25_rooms
The lowest Number of hotels, of value 679.0 was reported at Year 250_rooms_or_more

In general Number of hotels has rose over the Year.

The line significantly remained stable by 1758.0 from Year 100_rooms_or_more to 250_rooms_or_more,increased by 1079.0 from Year 250_rooms_or_more to From_100_to_249_rooms,increased by 3353.0 from Year From_100_to_249_rooms to From_25_to_99_rooms, and lastly, increased by 7059.0 from Year From_25_to_99_rooms to Less_than_25_rooms.
